page.title: 05The Wild Flowers Of Papa
page.content: Fishermen when they lost their way always knew where they were because of "{da scent o' flooers}" from Papa Stour.In the summer-time you can see {Sea-pinks}and bright yellow {Birds {foot Tre-foil}growing on the cliffs The west of the island is stoney heathland with thin soil.In the old days, people cut turves for their fires, animal-bedding and roofing. It provids rough grazing for sheep, and the flowers are very small.Tiny pink {Orchids},purple{Heather}and {Violets}and yellow{Tormentil }grow along-side rarer plants like {Lesser {Marshwort},{Bog Orchid }and {Allseed}. On the east side, the road-side ditches are full of {Marsh-Marigolds}. The meadows (slightly acid) are filled with {Daisies },{Buttercups},{Lady's {Smock }and red and white {Clover }. {
